      Create a new AbsolutePath that represents a (possibly non existing) location on filesystem. The AbsolutePath does not necessarily exists on the target FileSystem.

      Normalize this AbsolutePath by removing as many redundant path elements as possible.

      Get the AbsolutePath in this PathAttributesPair.

      Reads the target of a symbolic link (optional operation).
      AbsolutePath AbsolutePath.resolve(RelativePath other)
      Resolve a RelativePath against this AbsolutePath by appending all path elements in the RelativePath to the path elements in this AbsolutePath.
      AbsolutePath AbsolutePath.resolveSibling(RelativePath other)
      Resolves the given path to this paths parent path, thereby creating a sibling to this path.
      AbsolutePath AbsolutePath.subpath(int beginIndex, int endIndex)
      Returns a relative Path that is a subsequence of the name elements of this path.
